alert.note: Alert for Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Williamson and northwestern Travis Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leander, or near Cedar Park, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Park, Georgetown, Serenada, Anderson Mill, Leander, Lago Vista, Liberty Hill, Florence, Georgetown Dam, Sun City, Mahomet, Andice, Jonestown and Seward Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas.
